content: In an Ethernet network, what happens when two stations transmit simultaneously and a collision occurs?
options: The Switch automatically buffers the collided packets and retransmits them
The Router automatically buffers the collided packets and retransmits them
The data is automatically reconstructed at the receiver
The sending stations will retransmit the data after a waiting period
answer: The sending stations will retransmit the data after a waiting period

content: In TCP, starting from the connection establishment phase, what is the minimum number of segments exchanged between the sender (client) and the receiver (server) before the sender can start sending data?
In computer networking, an application is considered to use the Client-Server model when:
options: The application has an always-on server, and clients must connect to this server to exchange data
All application components have equal roles; an always-on server is not required
The application has an always-on client, and servers must connect to the client
Clients can interact directly with each other without a central server
answer: The application has an always-on server, and clients must connect to this server to exchange data

What happens when Host A sends a broadcast ARP request to find the MAC address of Host B on the same LAN?

content: Choose the best description of how the Ethernet protocol manages the use of the physical transmission channel.
options: Detects channel contention; if contention occurs, it delays transmission and retries after a period
Detects channel contention and reorders the sending nodes
answer: Detects channel contention; if contention occurs, it delays transmission and retries after a period

content: Which of the following fields does NOT exist in an IEEE 802.3 Ethernet frame header?
When a frame is delivered to a LAN switch and the destination address is not in the MAC address table, what will the switch do?
options: Forward the frame to the first available port
Flood the frame to all ports except the incoming port
Send a message back to the source to ask for the destination address
answer: Flood the frame to all ports except the incoming port

content: Which characteristic INCORRECTLY describes a connection in a wireless network?
options: Signal strength decreases as it moves away from the source
The data transmission rate is a constant and does not depend on the distance between sender and receiver
Signals from the source can reach the destination via multiple paths
Signal quality depends heavily on the surrounding environment
answer: The data transmission rate is a constant and does not depend on the distance between sender and receiver

content: How does a router using Distance Vector (DV) routing differ from one using Link State (LS) routing?
options: A DV router has a global view of the entire network topology
A DV router calculates the best route from LS routers
The best path in DV is calculated based on paths sent by neighboring routers
It uses the Shortest Path First (Dijkstra's) algorithm to determine the optimal path
answer: The best path in DV is calculated based on paths sent by neighboring routers

content: Choose the CORRECT statement about NAT (Network Address Translation).

answer: After being processed by NAT, certain fields in the data packet header will be modified

content: What is the primary goal of a firewall?

Why is an ARP (Address Resolution Protocol) query sent in a broadcast frame?

content: In network infrastructure, one benefit of using layering is:
